meanings.definition: To exceed in number of inhabitants.
meanings.sent1: The neighboring town will soon outpopulate our small village.
meanings.sent2: The city continues to outpopulate the surrounding areas.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits seem determined to outpopulate the squirrels in the park.
meanings.sent4: The weeds in the garden have managed to outpopulate the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The ants quickly outpopulate any other insects in the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The new housing development will outpopulate the old one.
meanings.sent2: The capital city tends to outpopulate the smaller towns.
meanings.sent3: The students in the chess club aim to outpopulate the members of the math club.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species can outpopulate the native plants in the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The virus can quickly outpopulate the body's immune system.

meanings.definition: To have a greater population than.
meanings.sent1: The country with the largest city will outpopulate the others.
meanings.sent2: The new zoo animals may outpopulate the existing ones.
meanings.sent3: The online game allows players to outpopulate their virtual cities.
meanings.sent4: The bacteria can outpopulate the antibiotics if not controlled.
meanings.sent5: The invasive species can outpopulate the native wildlife in the area.
